page.title: 10THE THAMES TIDAL DEFENCES
page.content:
Over the years the winter "surge tides" have been getting higher. The devastating floods of{1953}at{Canvey} and the increaing threats of flooding in{London}meant the Thames flood barriers had to be inproved. Fobbing Horse Barrier protects {Vange}creek from just{North}of{Benfleet}creek. {Easthaven}Barrier protects the{West} entrance of{Benfleet}creek. The barriers were completed by{1983.}They saved the building of 29.5km of raised banks. Fobbing barriers was designed by{Binnie}and Partners and built by{ {SirJohn Howard LTD}and cost Â£4.6M. The link wall and{Easthaven}barrier cost Â£3.9M .The width and height of the barrier were designed to suit the size of the barges taking waste to the Tips and pleasure craft that use the creek.
l.
